metadata.title: CVE-2017-6458 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the ctl_put* functions in NTP before 4.2.8p10and 4.3.x before 4.3.94 allow remote authenticated users to haveunspecified impact via a long variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1
sntp - 1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p10+dfsg-5ubuntu1').
